name: Snowdon Llanberis Path
description: The most popular and easiest route technically, though longest. Follows the railway.

name: Snowdon Pyg Track
description: Classic rugged route with spectacular views of the horseshoe. Steep sections.

name: Snowdon Miners' Track
description: Easy start past lakes then steep climb to join Pyg Track. Historic mine ruins.

name: Snowdon Watkin Path
description: Most scenic but toughest standard path. Starts near sea level. Final scree slope is loose.

name: Snowdon Rhyd Ddu Path
description: Quieter route offering dramatic ridge walking on Bwlch Main without scrambling.

name: Snowdon Ranger Path
description: Oldest path, winding up the western flank. Less crowded than Llanberis/Pyg.

name: Crib Goch
description: Famous knife-edge scramble. Not for beginners. Serious exposure.

name: Tryfan North Ridge
description: Iconic scramble. Hands needed most of the way. Jump between Adam and Eve stones.

name: Tryfan South Ridge
description: Easier way up Tryfan but still steep and rocky. Good descent option.

name: Glyderau Bochlwyd Horseshoe
description: Takes in Glyder Fach and Fawr via Bristly Ridge (G1) and Devil's Kitchen. Lunar landscape.

name: Y Garn via Devil's Kitchen
description: Great circular route visiting the dramatic Devil's Kitchen chasm. Best views of Tryfan.

name: Carnedd Llewelyn & Dafydd
description: High level ridge walk over the second and third highest peaks in Wales.

name: Carneddau via Aber Falls
description: Longer approach passing the famous falls and ascending Drum and Foel Fras.

name: Cadair Idris Pony Path
description: The classic easier side of Cadair Idris. Good path but steep finish.

name: Cadair Idris Minffordd Path
description: Spectacular route via the rim of Cwm Cau. Steep steps to start.

name: Cnicht (Welsh Matterhorn)
description: Looks like the Matterhorn from Porthmadog. lovely ridge walk.

name: Moel Siabod via Daear Ddu
description: Superb Grade 1 scramble on the ridge. Best view of the Snowdon Horseshoe.

name: Rhinog Fawr via Roman Steps
description: Rugged and remote. The Roman Steps are ancient medieval packhorse route.

name: Rhinog Fach & Y Llethr
description: Truly wild terrain. Heather bashing and rocky outcrops. For experienced walkers.

name: Nantlle Ridge
description: One of the best ridge walks in Wales. Usually done linear to Nebo.

name: Moel Hebog from Beddgelert
description: Domineering peak over Beddgelert. Steep ascent but great views.

name: Yr Aran
description: The overlooked peak south of Snowdon. Great solitude.

name: Arenig Fawr
description: Lonely mountain with a bothy memorial. superb panorama.

name: Aran Fawddwy
description: Higher than Cadair Idris but much quieter. Long ridge walk.

name: Tal y Fan
description: Northernmost 2000ft peak. Views to Llandudno and Conwy.

name: Mynydd Mawr (Elephant Mtn)
description: Great standalone peak with views into the Nantlle Ridge.

name: Elidir Fawr
description: Steep cone. Famous for the slate quarries and power station inside.

name: Moel Eilio Ridge
description: Lovely grassy ridge walk overlooking Llanberis. Great for sunsets.

name: Moelwyn Mawr
description: Interesting mix of industrial heritage and mountain wilderness.

name: Drum and Foel Fras
description: The remote northern end of the Carneddau. Very quiet.
